title: Super Easy Chicken and Dumplings Recipe
description: This hearty chicken and dumplings soup could not be simpler to make in one pot with easy ingredients for a comforting meal that tastes great!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Soup Recipes Chicken Soup Recipes Chicken and Dumpling Recipes Super Easy Chicken and Dumplings 4.7 (353) 303 Reviews 61 Photos This recipe for easy chicken and dumplings could not be more simple and it tastes great too! Submitted by ALLIE101 Updated on September 23, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 61 61 61 61 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 (10.5 ounce) cans condensed cream of chicken soup 3 (14 ounce) cans chicken broth 3 cups shredded cooked chicken meat 2 (10 ounce) cans refrigerated biscuit dough Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir condensed soup, chicken broth, and shredded chicken together in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until it begins to simmer. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cut each biscuit into quarters, and gently stir into the simmering soup. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until biscuits are no longer doughy in the center, 10 to 15 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 1,023 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 400 Calories 18g Fat 36g Carbs 22g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 400 % Daily Value * Total Fat 18g 23% Saturated Fat 5g 24% Cholesterol 50mg 17% Sodium 1924mg 84% Total Carbohydrate 36g 13% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Total Sugars 6g Protein 22g 43% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 53mg 4% Iron 3mg 17% Potassium 243mg 5% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Super Easy Chicken and Dumplings 01 of 61 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 61 Photo by  kaymac27 02/04/2025 Great flavors A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort Magnificent! I first sauteed some onions, carrots and celery, while the chicken breast was boiling on the stove, with nothing more than salt and pepper. I shredded and added the chicken, then the soup, and the stock. I was just shy of the quantity of stock, so I finished it with milk. I used Crescent Roll dough for the dumplings, which were pretty gummy, but dumplings are supposed to be gummy, so no complaints. A lot of extra fresh ground pepper. This one is a keeper for sure. 03 of 61 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 12/11/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Great flavors This is a good recipe and very easy to make. I used a rotisserie chicken. Very comforting dish! 04 of 61 Photo by  DS Ramsey 09/06/2024 Yummy quick way to make chicken dumplings. I used a pre-roasted chicken-really chopped fine; a dash of dried onion flakes,. Dropped the biscuits in the rolling both-these will slough apart which is good so they are big lumps of dough. 05 of 61 Photo by  Bill Brent 01/28/2024 Crowd-pleaser A keeper! I did make a few minor changes, added a third can of condensed cream of chicken soup and a few choice spices. 06 of 61 Photo by  FluffyMeal1547 01/07/2024 07 of 61 Photo by  FizzyPita4929 08/04/2023 I feel like with all the ingredients it wasn’t soupy. I kept adding chicken broth and basically used the entire box. The biscuits stayed doughy and it came out like mush lol. We did Brocolli instead of carrots. Well, the Brocolli didn’t get soft. Def won’t be making this again. 08 of 61 Photo by  OldGum1717 07/07/2023 I used a whole 48oz of chicken broth,2 10oz cans of cream of chicken. Also I like mine thicker so I added 4 teaspoons of cornstarch. Added 3 chicken cubes. And used only 1 can of buttery jumbo biscuits, flattened & cut into 8, they cooked so better in smaller peices. For the chicken I bought already pulled rotisserie chicken from Walmart. I used shaved carrots & added Italian, Organo & pepper. Super easy & very good! 09 of 61 Photo by  AquaPlate1448 03/22/2023 It is absolutely delicious and so easy to cook I recommend to use this recipe if you are cooking chicken dumplings 10 of 61 Photo by  Sarah Stewart 09/04/2022 Perfect 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Quick and Super Easy Chicken and Dumplings 182 Ratings Herbed Dumplings 276 Ratings Healthier Slow Cooker Chicken and Dumplings 57 Ratings Chicken Dumpling Soup 61 Ratings Slow Cooker Chicken and Dumplings 9,947 Ratings Chicken and Dumplings with Vegetables 1,310 Ratings Easy Slow Cooker Chicken and Dumplings 304 Ratings Chicken with Herb Dumplings 7 Ratings Chicken and Dumplings IV 281 Ratings Rolled Dumplings 287 Ratings Better than Cracker Barrel Chicken 'n Dumplings 63 Ratings Beginner Chicken and Dumplings 59 Ratings Southern Chicken and Dumplings 60 Ratings Chef John's Chicken and Dumplings 209 Ratings Instant Pot Chicken and Dumplings 83 Ratings Polish Chicken and Dumplings 181 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
